title: Wristrest
text: This wristrest is inscribed on its top side with an extensive poetic commentary in regular running script (<I>hsing-shu<I>) by the well-known Kuang-tung calligrapher, Ch'en Feng. Graduated in 1832, Ch'en was a noteworthy teacher and researcher in several areas of study and was highly regarded as a calligrapher in all scripts. Engraved in the skin on the wristrest's reverse side (shown here) is a stylish inscription in clerical script (<I>Li-shu<I>) which records its ownership by the "Early Studies Studio," and dating to the fourteenth year of the Tao-Kuang period (1835).
description: dark brown wristrest carved with 3 lines of text on front, one line of text on back
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
